news:news.news:title: Road trips, dark chocolates, yoga, music... Hamdard CMO has much to do even on weekends
news:news.news:description:
For Mansoor Ali, Chief Marketing Officer, Hamdard India, weekends are all about exploring less travelled locales. When travelling isn’t on the list, he spends most of his time listening to his favourite music list or reading a book. 

 

Read on to know more about his idea of a perfect weekend:

 

On a typical weekend you will find me…

               With a book, or with my bike on roads less travelled. Or with a select group of like minded people. ( If 'typical' means being in town)

My idea of relaxing is…

A trip to the Himalayas, with no agenda, no plan. No schedules or touristy itineraries. Walk, hike or drive around, build a fire and just feel the beauty around you.

 

 

One vice I cannot do without…

Bitter Chocolate, upwards of 85% cocoa.

 

I love a staycation/ adventure…

 

Admire new places, but not the tourist destinations. Feeling and absorbing the vibe, being with the locals, experiencing the food, colours and the myriad ways in which humans interact with each other.

 

 

I confess, I…

Have OCD! Many obsessions – cleanliness, pattern perfection, yoga.

 

I spend me-time on…

Listening to music. Every week it’s a different artiste/band that takes over, and we delve deep into the genre. Currently it’s the Velvet Underground. 

 

The last show I binge watched…

Breaking Bad. 

 

I can make a...

mean guy turn into a sweet angel with my mutton curry!

 

A skill/ hobby I want to learn this year :

 

(Get X-ray vision. Never been tried ….who knows !)

 

My next vacation/ adventure will be… 

 

Ladakh and Zanskar Valley are on the agenda, though not for the first time.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Meet Anupam Bokey: Binge-watcher and family man
news:news.news:description:
Anupam Bokey, VP-Marketing, RP Sanjiv Goenka Group, is a binge-watcher. He cannot help himself from watching episode after episode of his favourite shows all night, he tells exchange4media, as he reveals how he unwinds at the end of a hectic week. 
 
Interestingly, Bokey also uses his down-time to read up on all the latest trends and developments in the world of branding and advertising. In addition to all this, Bokey is above all a family man. He loves to spend time with his daughters and is willing to do everything it takes to bond with them to make up for the time he spends away from them. 
 
Read along to know more about his idea of unwiding:
 
On a typical weekend you will find me...
With my family and indulging in activities that help me bond with them - be it shopping, watching a movie or grabbing dinner at a restaurant.   

My idea of relaxing is...
My job involves a lot of travel and I barely get time to be with my family, hence my ideal way of relaxing is spending quality time with my daughters.

One vice I cannot do without...
I do not have vices as such, but if binge-watching digital videos till wee hours is a vice, I’m totally guilty of it.

I love a staycation/adventure...
I am always game for adventure. I feel it is an indispensable tool to discover the world around you.  

I spend me-time on...
Understanding the ever-evolving branding and marketing ecosystem is not only a job requirement, but it is also a passion point. It is what drives me. Hence, I devote a lot of time on the internet learning about the latest branding and marketing innovations.

The last show I binge watched...
The last series I binge-watched was Inside Edge 1.  Sports is a passion point, especially cricket, and this viewing prompted me to associate with Inside Edge II.

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...
Learning how to play an instrument has been on my radar for a couple of years.And this year I would certainly try to take a fair shot at it. 

My next vacation/adventure will be ...
My daughter is in the 10th grade. Once all the pressure is over, I would like to head to the US or Europe with my family for a short getaway.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Tyroo CRO's varied interests make for an adventurous life
news:news.news:description:
While his job keeps him quite busy with numbers, revenue, partnerships and profits, Akshay Mathur, Chief Revenue Officer at Tyroo, sure knows how to have fun on weekends and plan holidays well in advance. This week on Chillout we at exchange4media caught up with him to find out how he loves to balance his holidays with staycations, some full of adventure, and a few cultural ones which involve peaceful strolls around the city he is in. A doting father, he makes sure to spend some quality time with his kids even on hectic days. On weekends, he likes to take them out to parks, malls and play areas. Mathur also talks to us about his passion for collecting some of the finest whiskeys in the world. He says, “Every time I visit a duty free store at the airport, i feel like a kid in a candy shop.”

 

Read along to know more about his idea of a perfect weekend:

 

On a typical weekend you will find me... Chilling with family, watching a movie or throwing a house party for friends.

 

 

My idea of relaxing is... Traveling without an agenda - visit a beach resort, relax in the pool, get into a spa, spend the evenings next to the sea sipping a couple of Budweiser's.

 

One vice I cannot do without... My addiction to the mobile. e-mails, reading blogs and work take up most of my time.

 

I love a Staycation/adventure... I love staycations for short trips and adventure holidays for longer and interesting places.

 

 

 

I confess, I am a... big fan of Bryan Adams, still.

 

I spend me-time on...  watching TV shows, movies and series. Give me a day alone at home and I can watch movies non-stop. I love the old rom-coms, action and classic comedy movies.

 

The last show I binge watched... GOT, Suits and the classics like Two and a Half Men, HIMYM, The 70's Show and Friends.

 

I can make a mean... Unfortunately I wouldn't survive too long on Maggi and Chai-Toast. That's all I know.

 

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year... I seriously want to learn to play the guitar this year.

 

My next vacation/adventure will be ... US, West Coast.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: A road trip with music is all that Radio One's Vineet Singh Hukmani needs to relax
news:news.news:description:
Vineet Singh Hukmani, Managing Director & CEO, 94.3 Radio One India, believes that the combination of music and cars is a sacred one. No wonder then that a road trip is his perfect idea of relaxation. And not just listening to music, Hukmani also has a penchant for penning songs. He often spends his me-time writing lyrics. Read on to know more about Hukmani and his other passions.


On a typical weekend you will find me... 

Watching a Hollywood movie with my family. 

My idea of relaxing is...

A road trip with my favourite music or the gym to forget the world around me. The combination of music and cars is a sacred one for me. 

One vice I cannot do without... 

Chocolate is a vice I can never give up! 

I love a staycation/adventure... 

A beach with white sand and crystal clear blue water is all I need. 

I confess, I am a...

Rebel without a cause. A romantic without hope! 

I spend me-time on...

Writing songs that stir the soul

The last show I binge watched...

I don’t binge watch. I prefer being outdoors. If it is a screen, it has to be a large IMAX screen.

One day I wish to become a...

Rock music performer and hopefully earn from it! 

A skill/hobby I want to pursue this year...

Yoga

My next vacation/adventure will be ...

Paris or Costa Rica
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Head-Brand Marketing, ixigo, has tried some of the most daring adventure sports
news:news.news:description:
Shuchi Chawla, Head- Brand Marketing, ixigo, craves adventure when she is travelling. But when she happens to be home, she prefers to keep things slow and relaxed by spending time with family, cooking low carb meals on weekends. Lying on a beach with nothing but her e-reader for company, doing nothing, is her idea of bliss. She admits she never misses a chance to explore new places and cuisines. 

On a typical weekend you will find me...

At home, experimenting with cooking healthy low carb meals, reading and catching up on my favourite sitcoms and also spending time with my husband and family.

My idea of relaxing is...

Lying on a beach with my Kindle.

One vice I cannot do without... 

Desserts- cakes, ice creams, cheesecakes, I love them all.

I love a Staycation/adventure... 

Adventure. Scuba diving, sky diving, parasailing and off-roading. Bungee Jumping is next.

 I confess, I am a...

Travel junkie. Love exploring and learning about different cultures, history and cuisines. I like to trek and try some adventure sports as it is always an enriching experience.

I spend me-time on...

Long walks and music.

The last show I binge watched...

Shark Tank.

To save my life, I can make a mean...

Dark Chocolate Mousse.

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...

Baking.

My next vacation/adventure will be…

Japan. Would love to see cherry blossoms, and experience their food and culture.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Shrenik Gandhi's de-stress mantra: Watching stand-up comedy shows & web series
news:news.news:description:
Shrenik Gandhi, CEO and Co- Founder, White Rivers Media, makes sure he goes completely ‘offline’ on weekends. Despite being addicted to his work, Gandhi believes in maintaining a work-life balance. Catching up on sleep, attending stand-up comedy shows and watching web series help him take a break from the stressful work life.

Read on to find out more about Gandhi and his weekend indulgences:

On a typical weekend you will find me... 
Catching up on sleep and going totally offline! Being in the digital space, you often end up working in real time, which means late working nights and early working mornings. Due to which, both are rare during mad weekdays.

My idea of relaxing is...
Stand-up comedy and theatre are my go to. I love attending gigs and watching comedy shows/web series online. They help me zone out of the stressful work life, chill a little and get a different perspective to life.

One vice I cannot do without... 
Junk food!! Can’t, just can’t, get away from it. Writing this while binging on a pack of chips. 

I love a staycation/adventure...  
A completely unplanned trip, with no planned destination or duration. I remember doing something like this on my last trip to Europe. We left Luzern without any agenda and returned at the end of the day with a plethora of memories and adventures. It was an amazing experience!

I confess, I am a... 
Mad foodie.

I spend me-time on... 
Long walks & music (music on, world off!)

The last show I binge watched...
Comicstaan on Amazon Prime

I can make a mean ... to save my life...
Maggi and a cuppa chai. I will survive, trust me :)

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year... 
Playing drums. Been on my bucket list for quite a few years now.

My next vacation/adventure will be ...
As mentioned, unplanned and thrilling, somewhere in Europe.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Country Manager, India & Gulf, Tourism Australia, loves cricket, music and siestas
news:news.news:description:
Nishant Kashikar, Country Manager, India & Gulf, Tourism Australia, likes to spend time at home with family, listening to music on weekends. You will often also find him playing a game of T20 cricket at one of the ovals in Mumbai. 

Read on to find out more about Kashikar and his weekend indulgences:

On a typical weekend you will find me...

Pursuing my hobby with my mates, playing a T20 cricket game at one of the ovals in Mumbai.

My idea of relaxing is...

Spending time at home with family, a siesta, and listening to music.

One vice I cannot do without...

Responding to emails, and keeping my inbox clean!

I love a Staycation/adventure...

A calm, peaceful and relaxing staycation, as there are enough adventures in our lives!

I confess, I am a...

Workaholic and a foodie.

I spend me-time on...

Taking a long walk or a jog.

The last show I binge watched...

I don’t believe in binge watching. One at a time, please.

I can make a mean...

Omelette.

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...

Staying fit, and improving my game.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Deepak Dhar’s idea of relaxing is playing badminton with daughter
news:news.news:description:
Deepak Dhar, Co- Founder and CEO of Banijay Group Asia, obviously has very hectic schedules and long working hours on weekdays. But Dhar makes sure he spends his weekends winding down with family, something that helps him refresh for the next week.  He loves playing badminton with his daughter Anushka and is a self-confessed “hopeless cook”.  

Read on to find out more about Dhar and his weekend indulgences

On a typical weekend, you will find me...

Winding down and thinking of new ideas

My idea of relaxing is...

Playing squash with my partner or playing badminton with my daughter Anushka

One vice I cannot do without…

Collecting all different kinds of single malt from various airports. I am a single malt collector

I love a staycation/adventure…

I love staycations. The best staycation that I have had so far was in Austria in Innsbruck where I along with wife Neha and daughter Anushka did paragliding and white water rafting. We also went to Florence where we did the Gelato trail tasting and Vespa wine tasting.

I confess, I am a...

Hopeless cook

The last show I binge watched...

Sacred Games

I can make a mean ... to save my life...

As I said, I am a hopeless cook

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year

I would love to play the guitar

My next vacation/adventure will be
Alaska
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Umang Bedi is a health buff, voracious reader, golf player all rolled into one
news:news.news:description:
From the Managing Director at Intuit, India & Emerging markets at the age of 27, to the Managing Director, South Asia at Adobe, to CEO & MD, India & South Asia, Facebook to his entrepreneurial journey of leading Dailyhunt, Umang Bedi's hectic schedules have been unable to deter his resolute march towards a healthy lifestyle. While for many, crash diets are the quick-fix solutions when it’s about losing weight, Bedi believes that shedding extra pounds is primarily achieved through good sleep, a proper diet, regular exercise and strength training. In addition to the program LeanScience, a scientific approach to improve one’s health, Bedi's personal trainer turned his lean mission into an analytical science to measure and record all aspects of his health, helping him reduce from 140 kgs to 77 kgs today. Apart from taking his love for fitness to a whole new level, Bedi loves spending time playing golf with friends. His idea of leisure also includes cooking for family and unwinding with a good read.

To know more about his idea of a perfect weekend, despite the long hours at work, read on:

On a typical weekend you will find me... 

Cooking a meal for my family and catching up on my reading.

My idea of relaxing... 

Is a round of golf with friends. Nothing is as cathartic as spending time on the links with good company.

One vice I cannot do without... 

I am addicted to diet Coke! It is the one thing my fridge is always stocked with!

I love a Staycation/adventure... 

I love a bit of adventure and a lot of me-time. The place is not as important as the time spent with family.

 

 

I confess, I am a... 

Health buff. From counting calories to lifting weights to HIIT, I love working out!

 

I spend me-time on...

Lying on my couch, reading! I am a voracious reader and enjoy fiction as well as non fiction.

The last show I binge watched...

Game of Thrones. I love the ‘world building’. I think GRR Martin is a genius in the way he is able to create such wonderful characters you root for one moment and hate the next.  I think the show has managed to capture the soul of the books quite well.

I can make a mean...

Omelette. Friends and family swear by it!

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...

Nature fascinates me a lot and I would love to start trekking seriously.

My next vacation/adventure will be...

Jaguar spotting in the Amazon Rain-forest is on the bucket list!
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Weekends for Sushil Matey are about reading, Bollywood movies and music
news:news.news:description:
For Sushil Matey- Director- Marketing, Livpure, weekends mean taking a small break from the hectic work life and enjoying some me-time reading about human evolution to fulfill his fascination with spirituality and anthropology. He also loves being with friends, singing in his free time and unwinding to the voice of Kishore Kumar.

Read on to find out more about what his weekends are like:



On a typical weekend, you will find me...

Enjoying and engaging in conversations with friends. A typical weekend is spent at Mumbai Cricket Association Club’s Spin Bar.

My idea of relaxing is...

As a marketing person, my work schedule is always hectic and packed. I like spending time in the hills to relax and unwind.

One vice I cannot do without...

It is said that one should never share their vices in public. However, if I have to point out one, it shall be single malt, preferably Glenfiddich.

I love a staycation/adventure...

I believe that hill stations are the best places for relaxation and staycation. You get to see new people, new cultures, try out new delicacies and cuisines. And above all, you tend to make new memories of the places you have visited.



I confess, I am a...

I believe in spirituality, good vibes and a sense of belonging. However, I must confess I am an atheist.

I spend me-time on...

Like I said above, spirituality and anthropology fascinates me. I like to spend my me-time reading Stoics and human evolution. Eckhart Tolle is one of my favourite authors. Currently, I am reading Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind by Yuval Noah Harari.

The last show I binge watched...

I generally prefer old Hollywood and Bollywood movies over shows. However, the last one which I binge-watched was Sacred Games on Netflix.

I can make a mean ... to save my life...

I make a mean cup of coffee.



A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...

I like singing in my free time and love to unwind and relax to the voice of Kishore Kumar. Being a music aficionado, I want to learn guitar this year.

My next vacation/adventure will be….

Sicily. Italy is the city where I envisage my next vacation to happen.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Prashant Puri's weekends are for family, badminton, late-night snacking
news:news.news:description:
For Prashant Puri, Co-founder and CEO of Adlift, the idea of a perfect weekend is to spend quality time with family with a game of squash or badminton thrown in. Keeping his entrepreneurial spirit alive, besides running AdLift, a digital marketing & advertising agency, Puri is also a member of the Entrepreneurship Advisory Board (EAB) at Columbia University, mentoring & working with young entrepreneurs to help them build successful enterprises. Despite being addicted to his work, he makes sure that he maintains a perfect work-life balance. Along with his interest in sports, Puri enjoys staycations wherein he spends time with his boys including helping them with homework to playing board games. Read to know more:

On a typical weekend you will find me... 

Surrounded by my family and friends. A swim, a game of squash or badminton keeps me occupied. Long weekends also mean road trips!

My idea of relaxing is… 

Friends and a fine single malt (or two)!

One vice I cannot do without...  

A late-night snack. Netflix goes best with a side of chips or chocolates!

I love a Staycation/adventure...  

A staycation. There’s so much I can do with my family at home, from homework with my boys (I’m not kidding!), to playing board-games, engaging in mindless dancing and watching movies.


I confess, I am a… 

Person addicted to work. I love what I do!

I spend me-time on… 

Playing badminton. 

The last show I binge watched... 

The Looming Tower on Amazon Prime. I always end up binge watching series that are based on true events.

I can make a mean... 

Bowl of Maggie Noodles. It’s my go-to comfort food!  

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year... 

I have always wanted to become a certified scuba diver. I plan to finish the final stages of the certification this year.


My next vacation/adventure will be...

A road trip to Spiti Valley in October.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Rahul Vira spends weekends bonding with friends and cooking for family
news:news.news:description:
Being the CEO of a big brand is no mean feat. A barrage of work, reams of calls, tons of emails and a plethora of tasks to complete. And so, weekends come as a respite from the gruelling work week, giving the much-needed dose of rest and recreation. For Rahul Vira, CEO, Skechers South Asia Pvt. Ltd, weekends are about sampling different cuisines, catch-up time with friends and more.  Read on...

On a typical weekend you will find me...
Cooking, chilling or meeting friends

My idea of relaxing is...
I’m a foodie. I love trying different cuisines. There is a new Brazilian restaurant in Mumbai. I’m planning to check out the vegetarian options it has in store for me.

One vice I cannot do without...
I don’t know if it’s a vice, but getting up early and going for running, walking or gyming.

I love staycation/adventure...
There was a time when I loved adventures, but now with kids and all, I opt for staycations. But given a chance to add in a little bit of adventure, I’ll definitely do that.

I confess, I am a...
Passionate person. I give my everything to any task that I take up.

I spend me-time on...
Whatever relaxes me; be it going to the garden with kids or catching up on a good movie.

The last show I binge watched...
Rocky Series

I can cook a mean... to save my life
Middle-eastern cuisine. My father once told me if you learn to cook, you’ll never have to starve or be dependent on anyone. From then on, I’ve inculcated this habit.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Weekends are about reading, family time & meeting friends: CEO, Sakal Media Group
news:news.news:description:
From reading newspapers to his vast and ever growing collection of books without interruption, Pradeep Dwivedi, Chief Executive Officer, Sakal Media Group prefers weekends at home with his family. He is a self-proclaimed foodie across genres both domestic and exotic, and is especially partial to desserts. He wants to learn the subtle art of great cooking even if it is for one or two signature dishes. Read on to find out more about Dwivedi and his weekend life:

On a typical weekend you will find me...
Getting up early to make that special cup of tea for my wife. Reading over a dozen newspapers for content and not just scanning them for advertisements carried and missed. Catching up on sleep or friends and typically planning the week ahead. Occasional outings in the city with family or to my mum’s house at Chandigarh is also interspersed in this.

My idea of relaxing is...
Reading my vast and ever growing collection of books without interruption, though I must admit that it is not always easy to do so.

One vice I cannot do without...
Following US politics on TV/ Web/Apps and pretty much everywhere else



I love a Staycation/adventure...
I truly enjoy staycations where you allow the location to slowly soak in and be one with. I enjoy eating the local food at local joints, and talking to residents and discovering sights that are off the regular tourist trail. As a family, we typically do not like very rushed vacations in which you would pack too much, leaving little time to build memories for a lifetime.

I confess, I am a...
Foodie across genres both domestic and exotic. I plead guilty to being especially partial to desserts.

I spend me-time on...
Social networks, especially Twitter, following a lot of professional colleagues and personal friends. Engaging with the wide diversity of thought and opinions of people especially over a nice cup of coffee is more addictive stimulant, than any other alternate.

The last show I binge watched...
Here, I would like to join the crowd and shout out Sacred Games on NetFlix! While both actors Nawazuddin Siddiqui and Saif Ali Khan acted superbly and it had great direction, my very dear friend, Kubbra Sait literally took the cake with her outstanding and pivotal performance. It was simply awesome!

I can make a mean ... to save my life...
Maggi Masala, I confess. For a foodie, I have been very recalcitrant in actually donning the apron. I guess that it is something I should take time out for, in the coming days.



A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...
The subtle art of great cooking, even if it is for one or two signature dishes. My superbly talented wife, Deepti, has spoilt me thoroughly with her culinary skills and perhaps it is time I return the favour, albeit in a limited way.

My next vacation/adventure will be...
As a family, we’ve been planning a long US vacation spanning both coasts, and meeting friends, family, and adventures undiscovered for some time now. This has so far not fructified with school and college calendar constraints of our two daughters gaining priority. Hopefully, we shall plan it in the coming year.

In immediate future, I have an IAA Global Conference coming up in Bucharest, Romania, a city/country I have never visited before, so it should be very interesting.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Chillout: Foodie, fitness buff, entrepreneur...Vidooly's Subrat Kar is a learner for life!
news:news.news:description:
Long gone are the days of gender stereotypes where the kitchen was the sole 'responsibility'of the women of the house. Today, men take pride in their cooking skills and validating this very sentiment is Subrat Kar, Co-founder & CEO, Vidooly. From his engineering days where Kar was the happy owner of a small restaurant to being a professional now, his passion for cooking has endured the test of time. Not only this, but Kar also focuses on leading a healthy and fit lifestyle, be it cycling to running 5 km every day, or even playing badminton like a pro, his routine is fixed in the evening even post office hours. 7-8 hours of sleep is a must for him in order to have a productive day at work.
Proud of his humble beginnings to raising his own firm in Noida, Kar might have come a long way but he is very much true to his roots back in Odisha. Excerpts:

One a typical weekend you will find me...
 Throughout the week I like to work hard and then play harder. On weekends, I like to wake up early and invest most of my time in several activities like cycling, running and playing badminton. 
Then, I do take some work home as I catch up with candidates who are interested in joining Vidooly. 
Having said that, the rest of the weekend, I take time out from my responsibilities to watch a few movies and most importantly try new recipes that I follow on YouTube. Sometimes I go out on short weekend trips or hang out with friends over a few drinks and explore our capital city’s most popular delicacies.  


My idea of relaxing is...
Sound sleep of at least 8 hours every day and waking up early, which helps me focus my mind into more productive things. I feel that a well slept mind and body is the key to being relaxed throughout the day.
One vice I can't do without...
I am a big time foodie and I look forward to a grand layout of my favourite dishes at dinner. Odiya cuisine is my favourite and I can have it anytime. 
I love a Staycation/adventure...
I am more of a sun ‘n’ sand person and I love chilling out by the beach. I am not good with long haul flights, so I prefer to travel within the country or anywhere near the coastal area. This year, I have prepared a travel itinerary especially to cover most of Odisha and South India. 
I confess I...
am glad that I could hone my cooking skills in due course of time. Maybe, someday I hope to beat Sanjeev Kapoor at cooking :-) 
I spend me-time on...
Staying healthy. I believe we all need to keep ourselves fit and healthy in order to work better. Also, I spend a lot of my time in guiding budding entrepreneurs, educating myself with new technologies or investing in any topic that I find interesting. These days, I am learning Blockchain.   
The last show I binge watched...I recently binge watched "Memories". It's an original show on Viu by Vikram Bhatt. I really enjoyed it. 
I can make a mean... I can cook anything for my survival except Chapaati :-) 
A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...To become an expert in swimming.
My next vacation/adventure will be...Planning to visit Gopalpur sea beach, which is located at Ganjam district in the southern part of Odisha sometime this year. Also enjoy the boat ride at Chilika lake in Odisha.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Karan Gupta's weekends are about culinary escapes, Netflix and books
news:news.news:description:
From culinary escapes in the city to Netflix time, Karan Gupta, Managing Director, Zirca Digital Solutions, ensures he does weekends just right. The MD loves exotic vacations by the sea, immersing himself in a thought-provoking fiction book and stay-cays with a dash of adventure. Gupta shares how he slips into the weekend mode, a hobby he wishes to learn this year and more... 

On a typical weekend, you will find me...
Exploring new culinary experiences in and around the city.

My idea of relaxing is...
A vacation near the sea.

One vice I cannot do without...
Netflix.

I love a staycation/adventure...
Definitely staycation, with a bit of adventure just to make it interesting.

I confess I am a...
Comic book fan

I spend me-time on...
Reading fiction

The last show I binge-watched...
Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown.

I can make a mean… to save my life
Spaghetti aglio e olio

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...
Scuba diving

My next vacation/adventure will be...
In Japan
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Chillout: #ARM Worldwide CEO loves long walks, vacations and Bob Dylan
news:news.news:description:
From crossing a wooden bridge in Bhutan to having a beach-blast at Greece, Manas Gulati, Co-Founder & CEO, #ARM Worldwide, is quite a travel junkie. Immersing himself in good music, long walks and spending time with his little bundle-of-joy remain his favourite ways of unwinding. Gulati shares his idea of a weekend escape, how he updates his skills, his upcoming vacation plans and more...

On a typical weekend you will find me...
Previously, my weekends were all about my "me time" with my wife. I am big sports enthusiast and weekends were all about playing cricket or soccer. However, now that I'm a daddy to the sweetest two-year-old daughter, I try and spend my larger time playing with her over weekends.

My idea of relaxing is...
There are a lot of things I do to relax. I love long walks after dinner to reflect on my day and plan for the next. For relaxation on-the-go, music is what I head to. I have playlists of Bob Dylan, Simon & Garfunkel and many other of my favourite artistes which I dive into once or twice a day to find serenity.

One vice I cannot do without...
Want to cut down a few hours of watching TV.

I love a Staycation/adventure...
When you work on what you love, everyday is a staycation! (Laughs) I'm more of an adventure type, all credit to my wife Shreya for that. It has been like clockwork where every year we plan a long trip together. Last we were crossing a wooden bridge in Bhutan and before that we were chilling in the evening, enjoying beach winds of Greece.


I confess, I am a...
This one's tricky! I can confess that despite being a time management junkie, I also procrastinate. Ever since I was a student I have been conscious about this. Still, there are lazy days and we all love them, right?!

I spend me-time on...
Sports and sweating it out at my club's cricket matches or, over squash with my company's co-founder and great friend Abhishek. Other times when I'm not sweating it out, I love catching re-runs of my favourite TV shows, specifically House of Cards and FRIENDS.

The last show I binge watched...
MindHunter by Joe Penhall


I can make a mean...
This would be so really easy and short - Maggi! If I wouldn't have to be so really mean to my meal, I'll cut and fry few veggies to go with it!

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...
This year, my focus is to keep up with the data analytics trends in the industry. It requires me to go back to my math theories and statistics books from college sometimes. Coming to hobbies, I'd love spending my time reading books. 

My next vacation/adventure will be ...
As a matter of fact, this is currently under discussion between Shreya and me. Most probably, we are planning to visit Scotland and London.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: e4mChillout: Virat Khullar loves spending weekends at home
news:news.news:description:
Virat Khullar, Head of Marketing at Renault India, loves to be at home on weekends. He goes by the belief: Work hard on weekdays and enjoy the weekends. For him, the best thing about weekends is that he can sit in his balcony for hours just listening to music. Khullar confesses to being a child at heart and says he finds solace spending time with his 10-year-old son. Read on to find out more about Khullar and his weekend life:





On a typical weekend you will find me...
At home. Weekends are strictly for family. I believe in finishing my work in five days and chilling in the weekends.

My idea of relaxing is...
Sitting in my balcony, reading a book and listening to my favourite tracks. I love Sander Van Doorn, Jan Blomquist and Black Coffee.

One vice I cannot do without...
None actually. No such fixations yet.

A staycation/adventure trip I love...
In the Himalayas. Also, there are several places within driving distance from Gurgaon. These places are totally worth a visit. Going to these places with friends and family helps me unwind.




I confess, I am a...
Child at heart. Simplest of things excite me… nice weather, good coffee.

I spend me-time...
With my son. I love playing cricket with him and chatting up on his life. He is 10 years old.

The last show I binge watched...
Just finished Staircase. Wood-pecking all thriller shows on Netflix. By far, my favourite is Peaky Blinders!

I can make a mean ... to save my life...
I can make mean MESS surely to save my life! Don’t think have any survival skills!

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...
Cooking. But it is something I plan to learn every year!

My next vacation/adventure will be …
I book the next holiday before I finish one. I feel happy that way. So October and New Year are booked.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: e4mChillout: Atul Shrivastava, CEO, Laqshya Media Group, loves sweets, solace and wildlife
news:news.news:description:
Atul Shrivastava, CEO of Laqshya Media Group, loves his switch-off time, away from the hustle and bustle to discover some moments of solace on weekends. Shrivastava is an ardent music and nature-lover. Indulging in some scrumptious sweet delights is something he can't get enough of. He also opens up on his love of visiting wild-life sanctuaries around which most of his travels are centered...

On a typical weekend, you will find me… My typical weekend is spending quality time at home or out with my lovely daughters and wife.

My idea of relaxing is… I like to spend my leisure time close to nature and in a peaceful environment. I enjoy this by staying away from cellphones and the internet.
One vice I cannot do without… I have a massive sweet tooth. Sweets and desserts are something which I can't resist.


I love a Staycation/adventure… I am an adventurous person and love to visit jungles and wildlife sanctuaries. I go on jungle safaris with family and friends whenever I get the opportunity.
I confess I am... old-school! I was brought up with traditional Indian values and culture. I respect the Indian traditions and am a strong believer of it.
I spend me-time on… flights and tours.
The last show I binge watched… I don't spend time watching shows that frequently. But, recently visited the Kingdoms of Dreams and loved their production value and was fascinated by it.
I can make a mean…  Khichdi.
A skill/hobby I want to learn this year…I am passionate about music and want to learn to play the guitar this year.
My next vacation/adventure will be … Being an adventurous person I love visiting wildlife sanctuaries. So, I have planned my next trip to Sunderbans National Park in West Bengal to see the majestic tigers.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: e4mChillout: Spending time with family and books makes Vishal Jacob’s weekends special
news:news.news:description:
Vishal Jacob, Vice President for Digital Media and Marketing at Wavemaker India, quite understandably has a choc-o-bloc schedule on weekdays. One can only imagine the pressure he handles every single day working in the fast-paced digital space. But come weekend, and Jacob slips into the relaxation mode, spending time with wife & son and catching up on his hobbies of reading & music.

Taking his love for reading a step further, Jacob also turned author recently with a book on better living-- Connecting with yourself: Why we think, feel & act the way we do.

Read on to find out more about Jacob and his weekend indulgences:


On a typical weekend you will find me...

Entertaining or being entertained by my 7-year-old boy or discussing philosophy and life into the wee hours of the night with my wife and friends.

My idea of relaxing is...

Listening to some slow jazz music or songs from artists like Katie Melua, Norah Jones and George Ezra. Music is my recourse whether to wind down and relax or to perk up my mood!

One vice I cannot do without...

Beer and a good book. It’s a tie, so I must mention both!

A staycation I love …

Growing up in Goa, I have always found great joy by the beach and I tend to gravitate towards beach staycations. Visits with family to Bali, Perhentian Islands and the Phi Phi Islands have been some of the most memorable stays. My wife and I especially love the added atmosphere of live music at the beach side.

I confess…

I am a screen addict! I’d like to say it is because of my line of work in digital media and marketing, but I must admit that it isn’t entirely true.

I spend me-time…

Me-time is usually cozying up with a book, listening to jazz or strumming my trusted six strings.

The last show I binge watched…

Narcos and Game of Thrones

I can make a mean….…. to save my life...

Oh I can cook a really fabulous dinner, if you ask my wife. But naming the dish is always a problem, if you get what I mean. I guess the closest I can come to repeating my classics is a tangy Goan Fish Curry spiced to the gills!

My next vacation will be….

I have a large family and a large part of it is based in the US. My wife, kid and I tend to visit the States pretty often. Next on the cards is a visit to Miami and California early next year.

You recently wrote a book. If you have to describe it in one word, it would be…
Introspective

A key takeaway from your book would be…

It is a book about better living so there are quite a few. If I have to pick one, it’d be about the need to focus more on intrinsic activities and goals, i.e. things done for one’s own pleasure, for the sheer joy that the activity gives us. The more we indulge in them, the more we become happy!
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: e4mChillout: Parag Milk Foods' Akshali Shah spends a lot of time at her farm
news:news.news:description:
Akshali Shah, Senior VP, Strategy- Sales and Marketing, Parag Milk Foods, entirely spend her weekends connecting with family and friends. She calls herself a foodie and admits that she loves being at her farm, close to nature while also keeping herself updated with new-edge technologies.


On a typical weekend you will find me...
I am a family-oriented person. When I am not working on weekends, I like to be like any ordinary, lively girl who catches priceless moments with friends and family.

My idea of relaxing is...
Spending time at Bhagyalakshmi Dairy farm with cows and calves, understanding life at the farm, spending time on understanding organic vegetable farming. Being with nature is tremendously peaceful, calming and centering.


One vice I cannot do without...
As I am a foodie, I love experimenting with food whenever I get free time.

I confess, I am a...

Workaholic! Early in life, I decided on joining our family business – Parag Milk Foods and started preparing for the role ahead. I have realised that observing people and assessing the manner in which they tackle several tasks has always provided me with a method of self-education, which is much-needed in any achiever. Nearly eight years into the entrepreneurship realm, I admit that real-life education is more sustainable than theoretical aspects.

I spend me-time on...

On weekends you will find me spending time learning new-edge technologies, exploring digital platforms, and understanding global trends, which we can slowly and gradually incorporate into our business. Also, reading books is something I am fond of.

The last show I binge watched...
Madame Secretary.

I love a Staycation/adventure...
I had grown up in a village – Manchar that is surrounded by the Sahyadri hills. Roaming there, meeting all childhood friends is my idea of short breaks.

My next vacation/adventure will be ...
Travelling is what I enjoy the most as it exposes me to different cultures, food habits and perspectives, which I can draw inspiration from, even at work. The next place that I will visit is somewhere in Europe or USA. I haven’t decided exactly which one yet.

I can make a mean...
Cheesy vegetable pasta and guacamole dips and chips.

A skill I want to learn this year...
Workout is one big stress buster. I love to be fit. This year would like to learn Strength training and cross fit.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: e4mChillout: Nandini Dias enjoys her weekends with family, friends and food
news:news.news:description:
From immersing herself in a good book to catching up on movies and bonding with her family, Nandini Dias, the CEO of Lodestar, has her weekend priorities set straight. Dias is a sports enthusiast and loves playing games in her free time. She is also a good cook and can whip up lip-smacking aloo paratha, puran poli and many other delicacies.
The allure of unseen destinations urges Dias to travel and she confesses that she takes a day off while on work trips to explore the place.

"To get dates from the three men in my life is such a mammoth task that I have stopped dreaming about vacations," exclaims Dias.

Read on to find out more about Nandini Dias and her weekend indulgences…


On a typical weekend you will find me...

With the family. Saturday is about organising the week ahead and Sunday is about having fun-- playing, watching movies, eating and meeting friends.




My idea of relaxing is...

Walking, playing, reading, watching movies, listening to music and meeting friends.


One vice I cannot do without... 

Since I was a sportsperson, I never got into any vice. I used to play badminton. When I was playing, the rules of the game were tougher than today. You had to earn a point. You could not get a point if the opponent made a mistake. To last in such a game, one really needed stamina. So we would do a lot of things to just build speed and stamina. Vices would have nullified all the efforts.

A staycation/adventure I love...

Exploring new cities. Whenever I travel for work, I usually try to take out one day to see the place.



I confess, I am a...

A fan of romantic stories, books, movies …



I spend me-time on...

Walking during the day and reading at night


The last show I binge watched...

Wild Wild Country. Bhagwan Shri Rajneesh and my father were friends. So I watched it almost non-stop.


I can make a mean ...to save my life... 

Puran poli, aloo paratha, chapati, puri , thalipeeth…..


A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...

Every year, I think I will re-learn driving.


My next vacation/adventure will be ...

These days I just pray it happens. To get the three men in my life to give me dates is such a mammoth task that I have stopped dreaming about vacations!
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: e4mChillout: Nadia Chauhan’s weekends are about family time at farmhouse
news:news.news:description:
Nadia Chauhan, Joint Managing Director & Chief Marketing Officer of Parle Agro, like all of us, has her share of work blues. Chauhan doesn't always take time off, but when she does, it’s about indulging in family-time with her children, a weekend escape to her farmhouse, petting tigers in Thailand or a dreamy Christmas spent in London just ice-skating. Read on...

On a typical weekend you will find me...
Most weekends, we head to our farmhouse, which is about an hour and a half away from Mumbai, and spend our time there swimming, horse-riding, etc. We also spend a lot of time at Wellington Club.




My idea of relaxing is...
I really love travelling and as family, we love our travels. We like to plan leisure trips and just explore new places. We literally look at the map and zero down on the uncovered areas we want to explore.

I love a staycation/adventure...
The kids have great fondness for animals, and so a lot of places that we go to have animal experiences. Just recently, we were in Thailand petting tigers. We spent last Christmas in London ice-skating almost throughout the two weeks that we're there.




I spend me-time on...Driving is a de-stresser for me and I enjoy my drive to work as I listen to some music.

I can cook a mean ... to save my life...
Once in a while, we spend time cooking together. We really experiment a lot with what we do and so really don't have favourites. We are constantly looking at doing new things. Last time, we spent time cooking Mexican food and before we made healthy food.

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...
Scuba-diving is something I've been wanting to get started at for a long time.

My next vacation/adventure will be ...
Bali
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: e4mChillout: For Viu India's Marketing Head, weekends mean swimming, streaming music, family-time
news:news.news:description:
From Australian adventures to diving at Phi Phi, Shantanu Gangane, Marketing Head - Viu, India, seems to love the adrenaline rush and ticking it all off his bucket-list. On weekends, Gangane swims away the blues, loves gorging on sweets and finds solace in spending time with his seven-year-old daughter. He lets us in on his wonderful weekend life. Read on...

On a typical weekend you will find me... on a cycle or in the swimming pool.

My idea of relaxing is... spending time with my 7-year-old daughter, and nephew. Nothing like being with children and behaving like them.

One vice I cannot do without... an uncontrollable sweet tooth!
Staycation or adventure? adventure, any day – Australia.

I confess, I am...funnily, accident prone.

Me-time means...reading, watching content or streaming music.

The last show I binge watched... Love, Lust & Confusion on Viu.

I can make a mean...Biryani.

A skill I want to learn this year...Surfing.

My next vacation/adventure will be...Diving at Phi Phi.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: Chillout: A true Piscean, Chetan Asher loves to swim and relax at the beach
news:news.news:description:
Being the CEO of a digital marketing agency, we know, is not an easy job. Chetan Asher, Founder & CEO, Tonic Worldwide, obviously has a very busy schedule during the week. But come weekend, and one can see him relaxing at the beach for hours and watching TV series and movies.

We caught up with Asher to know what all he loves to do on weekends. Read on:


On a typical weekend you will find me...

I am a Piscean. And like most Pisceans, I love to swim and be at the beach. I am lucky that one of Mumbai's less frequented beaches is very close to my house. I make sure to squeeze out some time for swimming on weekends. Rest of my weekend is spent binging on TV series or brunching with family and friends. Some Saturdays, I also catch up with Tonickers, who are an extended family to me, for brainstorming on projects.

My idea of relaxing is...

Swimming or binge watching latest movies and series

One vice I cannot do without...

One would have been ideal, but there are a few for me. I love beer and end up trying a new craft beer or a new brand from across the world every other weekend. I am a vegetarian, but love experimenting with new restaurants in town.

I love a staycation/adventure... 
I love both, big cities and outdoors. Vacation for me is about immersing in the culture of a new place and an opportunity to collect new experiences. I love road trips. Last year, I went on a road trip across California and that was quite an experience. Driving across the length and breath of Mauritius, I saw the country in a way that even guidebooks would not have described.







I confess, I am a...
Foodie and travel junkie.

I spend me-time on...

Feeding my curiosity, browsing about everything under the sun. I like browsing particularly about design trends, typography…kind of obsessed with it.

The last show I binge watched...

I am watching multiple shows at this point. Blacklist, Mad Men and Ozark are what I am currently watching.

To save my life, I can make a mean...

Sandwich. Nothing beyond that. However, I like to team up with my mom who is an excellent cook and experiment, usually baking.

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year...

Get back to writing.

My next vacation/adventure will be ...

Going back to Japan. I went to Tokyo sometime back but, want to go to Hokkaido and other parts of the country as well. Also, an annual trip to both Kasuali and Goa is always there.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media

news:news.news:title: e4mChillout: Rana Barua loves reading, red wine and recharging with family
news:news.news:description:
With an experience of over two decades in the industry, much has been written about Rana Barua's long and illustrious career. Now the CEO of Creativeland Asia,he  has been associated with some of the most credible media outfits in the country including being the chief executive officer of WPP Group's Contract Advertising to now CLA. We find out how he beats the blues and utilises his time away from work, which ultimately him help sharpen his creative instincts. Read on.... 
On a typical weekend you will find me...relaxing at home.

My idea of relaxing is… catching up on reading, watching serials, and spending time with my family and friends.


One vice I cannot do without... Red Wine

I love a staycation/adventure... Goa, anytime!

I confess, I am a... health freak.

I spend me-time.. in the Gym and reading about new countries that my family and I need to visit.

The last show I binge watched...Peaky Blinders.

I can make a mean... Red Wine Bacon Chicken.

A skill/hobby I want to learn this year... I want to re-learn driving

My next vacation/adventure will be … Europe, as always.
news:news.news:keywords: advertising news, marketing, ooh, television, digital, print, radio, media
